subject: linear_algebra
title: Frobenius and Spectral Norms
contentHtml:
The Frobenius norm and spectral norm are two fundamental matrix norms in linear algebra.

The Frobenius norm measures the Euclidean length of a vector, while the spectral norm is related to the largest singular value of a matrix.
name: Frobenius norm
proofSketch: The proof involves showing that the spectral norm is the maximum singular value, and then bounding it by the Frobenius norm." },
intuition: These norms are important in machine learning as they help measure the magnitude of a matrix. The Frobenius norm is used in many algorithms, such as PCA and SVD.
